title:
On Laplacian and Distance Laplacian Spectra of Generalized Fan Graph & a
  New Graph Class
abstract:
Given a graph $G$, the Laplacian matrix of $G$, $L(G)$ is the difference of
the adjacency matrix $A(G)$ and $\text{Deg}(G)$, where $\text{Deg}(G)$ is the
diagonal matrix of vertex degrees.
  The distance Laplacian matrix $D^L({G})$ is the difference of the
transmission matrix of $G$ and the distance matrix of $G$.
  In the given paper, we first obtain the Laplacian and distance Laplacian
spectrum of generalized fan graphs.
  We then introduce a new graph class which is denoted by
$\mathcal{NC}(F_{m,n})$. Finally, we determine the Laplacian spectrum and the
distance Laplacian spectrum of $\mathcal{NC}(F_{m,n})$.
